item.title: Lauren add a quote by dave eggers
item.description: "In all my life I'd never been approached this way, the car pulling up, the Where you going? It was something I wish had happened hundreds of times. I was a looker - someone who looked over at every car at every traffic light, hoping something would happen, and almost never finding anyone looking back - always everyone looking forwards, and every time I felt stupid. Why should people look at you? Why should they care?" -- dave eggers

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "If people bring so much courage to this world the world has to kill them to break them, so of course it kills them. The world breaks every one and afterward many are strong at the broken places. But those that will not break it kills. It kills the very good and the very gentle and the very brave impartially. If you are none of these you can be sure it will kill you too but there will be no special hurry." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
Lauren add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "But it seems to me that once you begin a gesture it's fatal not to go through with it." -- John Updike

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "If you have the guts to be yourself, other people'll pay your price." -- John Updike

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Gloria Naylor
item.description: "But I don't believe that life is supposed to make you feel good, or to make you feel miserable either. Life is just supposed to make you feel." -- Gloria Naylor

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Gloria Naylor
item.description: "Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over." -- Gloria Naylor

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "I don’t know what you’re feeling. I won’t even pretend." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Kate Chopin
item.description: "The past was nothing to her; offered no lesson which she was willing to heed. The future was a mystery which she never attempted to penetrate. The present alone was significant." -- Kate Chopin

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "You put too much stock in human intelligence, it doesn't annihilate human nature." -- Philip Roth

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "So everything is necessary. Every least thing. This is the hard lesson. Nothing can be dispensed with. Nothing despised. Because the seams are hid from us, you see. The joinery. The way in which the world is made. We have no way to know what could be taken away. What omitted. We have no way to tell what might stand and what might fall." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "He said that those who have endured some misfortune will always be set apart but that it is just that misfortune which is their gift and which is their strength." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "What is the meaning of life? That was all- a simple question; one that tended to close in on one with years, the great revelation had never come. The great revelation perhaps never did come. Instead, there were little daily miracles, illuminations, matches struck unexpectedly in the dark; here was one." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "...she took her hand and raised her brush. For a moment it stayed trembling in a painful but exciting ecstacy in the air. Where to begin?--that was the question at what point to make the first mark? One line placed on the canvas committed her to innumerable risks, to frequent and irrevocable decisions. All that in idea seemed simple became in practice immediately complex; as the waves shape themselves symmetrically from the cliff top, but to the swimmer among them are divided by steep gulfs, and foaming crests. Still the risk must run; the mark made." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "The world keeps ending but new people too dumb to know it keep showing up as if the fun's just started." -- John Updike

item.title: Lauren add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "And so with the sunshine and the great bursts of leaves growing on the trees, just as things grow in fast movies, I had that familiar conviction that life was beginning over again with the summer." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Lauren add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Let us learn to show our friendship for a man when he is alive and not after he is dead." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "When someone you love dies, and you're not expecting it, you don't lose her all at once; you lose her in pieces over a long time—the way the mail stops coming, and her scent fades from the pillows and even from the clothes in her closet and drawers. Gradually, you accumulate the parts of her that are gone. Just when the day comes—when there's a particular missing part that overwhelms you with the feeling that she's gone, forever—there comes another day, and another specifically missing part." -- John Irving

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Imagining something is better than remembering something." -- John Irving

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "They were involved in that awkward procedure of getting to unknow each other." -- John Irving

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Jesmyn Ward
item.description: "I will not let him see until none of us have any choices about what can be seen, what can be avoided, what is blind, and what will turn us to stone." -- Jesmyn Ward

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "And when the event, the big change in your life, is simply an insight—isn't that a strange thing? That absolutely nothing changes except that you see things differently and you're less fearful and less anxious and generally stronger as a result: isn't it amazing that a completely invisible thing in your head can feel realer than anything you've experienced before? You see things more clearly and you <i>know</i> that you're seeing them more clearly. And it comes to you that this is what it means to love life, this is all anybody who talks seriously about God is ever talking about. Moments like this." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "Fiction is a solution, the best solution, to the problem of existential solitude." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Colum McCann
item.description: "The world spins. We stumble on. It is enough." -- Colum McCann

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Colum McCann
item.description: "Literature can remind us that not all life is already written down: there are still so many stories to be told." -- Colum McCann
